page.title: 14HOUSING IN RHOOSE
page.content: As mentioned on page 13 the housing in the older part of Rhoose is pre W.W.II. Since about 1960 a large amount of development has taken place with well-known building companies like {BARRATT and WESTBURY and WIMPEY building large estates on sites which were predominantly agricultural. These new estates are positioned to the North of the village with the bulk of them being built at the Western end of the village. The position of Cardiff Wales Airport makes development of desirable residential areas difficult at the North Eastern edge of the village. It is an important feature of most of the new housing that windows facing the airport runway have usually been double-glazed to provide adequate sound insulation.
